transportAdvice: The historic centre is compact and best explored on foot, with most major attractions within comfortable walking distance of each other. The city has a municipal bus network covering wider areas, and taxis are readily available throughout the city.

weather.description: Cool and occasionally rainy winter days make January one of the quieter months, good for sightseeing without crowds.
Mild temperatures begin to return with some rain still possible, but pleasant for outdoor exploration.
Spring arrives with warming days and occasional showers, ideal for visiting patios and gardens as they begin to bloom.
One of the most beautiful months with mild warmth, blooming flowers, and the famous Patio Festival typically taking place.
Warm and largely dry with long sunny days, excellent for sightseeing before the intense summer heat sets in.
Hot and dry conditions begin in earnest; mornings are the best time to visit outdoor sites before midday heat peaks.
One of the hottest months in Europe with temperatures frequently exceeding 40°C; plan activities for early morning or evening.
Intense heat continues through August; shade, hydration, and midday rest are essential for comfortable sightseeing.
Temperatures begin to ease slightly from peak summer, still warm and sunny with very little rainfall.
A pleasant autumn month with comfortable temperatures and occasional rain, making it a popular time to visit.
Cooler and wetter conditions return, but the city is quieter and atmospheric with autumn colours.
Cool winter weather with some rain and festive Christmas atmosphere in the city centre.
